rules.text: Truth claims require verifiable evidence to hold.
The ability to endure scrutiny and opposition strengthens a truth claim.
Regularly reflect on lessons from mentors to refine behavior.
Prioritize self-control over external validation.
Balance personal ambitions with universal ethical standards.

Avoid extremes by balancing action and restraint.

Acknowledge human impermanence.

warnings.text: Weak arguments may yield to stronger ones regardless of intrinsic validity.
Evidence gaps can create opportunities for falsehood to dominate.
Failure to adapt may lead to being swayed by transient opinions.
Neglecting self-reflection risks reinforcing ineffective behavioral patterns.
Inconsistent application of principles creates vulnerability to external disruptions.
Vanity can undermine judgment and decision-making.
Imbalance in actions may lead to instability.
Neglecting self-discipline leads to regret.
Ignoring natural limits causes frustration.

Overly rigid thinking can lead to ineffective responses.
Ignoring contextual factors may result in misaligned actions.
Inaccurate assessments of risk can compromise strategic success.
Failure to focus on controllable actions leads to wasted time and diminished effectiveness.
Excessive concern with others' opinions or circumstances distracts from personal improvement.

Lust and unchecked desires can distract from rational pursuits.
Excessive focus on preparation can prevent timely action.

Neglecting core values leads to existential regret.
Unexamined beliefs risk undermining ethical behavior.
Failure to distinguish control leads to anxiety and distress.
Misjudging the impact of events can cause unnecessary emotional turmoil.
Neglecting the distinction between necessity and opinion creates vulnerability to external fluctuations.
Avoid being swayed by others' opinions without personal verification.
Do not assume inherent truth without critical examination.
Be cautious of over-reliance on past strategies without adaptation.
